articles.title: US in talks over 10% Intel stake, White House confirms - BBC
articles.description: The potential deal could involve swapping government grants for shares in the chip making giant.

articles.title: Trump Embarks on $104 Million Bond-Buying Spree While in Office - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: President Donald Trump has bought hundreds of bonds since he returned to office, including those sold by US companies affected by the sweeping changes to federal policies he’s championed.

articles.title: Walmart recalls shrimp after FDA warns of radioactive isotopes - BBC
articles.description: Consumers in 13 states are being advised to throw away shrimp with the label Great Value.

articles.title: Dow Jones Futures: Palantir, Oracle, AMD Break Key Levels, Lead Growth Sell-Off; What To Do Now - Investor's Business Daily
articles.description: Palantir, Oracle, AMD and more sold off Tuesday. Other areas held up or rose.

articles.title: Japan's July exports clock steepest plunge in over four years, dropping by a more than expected 2.6% - CNBC
articles.description: The fall was sharper than the 2.1% contraction expected by economists polled by Reuters and compared to the 0.5% drop seen in June.

articles.title: Tesla Has Launched Its Robotaxi…Now What? - Ark Invest
articles.description: On June 22 in Austin, Tesla launched its robotaxi service to a limited group of users, beginning the shift in its model from one-time low-margin hardware sales to recurring, high margin revenues.  Now that it is scaling,  Tesla should be able to meet urban Au…

articles.title: What SoftBank, Government Investments Could Mean for Intel's Business—and Stock - Investopedia
articles.description: Intel shares jumped on Tuesday as investors responded to signals the Trump administration may throw the company’s troubled foundry business a lifeline.

articles.title: CoreWeave Stock (CRWV) Tumbles 38% Post-Earnings; Here’s How to Buy the Dip Without the Risk - TipRanks
Google announced the next step in its nuclear energy plans - The Verge
articles.description: Google is supporting the development of a next-generation nuclear reactor in a bid to get enough electricity for its AI data centers.

articles.title: More Fred Meyer closures, including a Seattle location, announced Tuesday - The Seattle Times
articles.description: Kroger announced the closure of two more Seattle-area stores, bringing the total to five and raising questions about claims of rising store theft.

articles.title: Viking Therapeutics Shorts Reap $514 Million as Stock Falls 40% - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: Viking Therapeutics Inc.’s worst stock drop on record has handed traders betting against the company a gain big enough to turn their money-losing year into a profitable one.

articles.title: Stick to Walmart, not Target, ahead of earnings this week, investment chief says - CNBC
articles.description: Victoria Greene, investment chief at G Squared Private Wealth, joined CNBC's "Power Check" Tuesday to share her thoughts on the big box retailers.

articles.title: All roads lead to inflation: Fed cut or not, Bitcoin may stand to gain - Cointelegraph
articles.description: Trump’s push for rate cuts and his Big Beautiful Bill leave the Fed trapped. Whether it cuts or holds, inflation is likely to rise, reshaping Bitcoin's macro narrative.

articles.title: Palantir Shares Plunge 9% Amid Slide In AI Stocks - Forbes
articles.description: Palantir shares have fallen around 15% across the last five days of trading, completely erasing gains made near the start of the month.

articles.title: Meta is shaking up its AI org, again - TechCrunch
articles.description: On Friday, The Information reported that Meta was preparing to tear down its existing AI org and reorganize it into four new groups. Four days later, the change has been made official with an internal memo.

articles.title: Hundreds of items just got a lot more expensive to import into the US because of Trump’s tariffs - CNN
articles.description: Hundreds of different goods just got a lot more expensive to import into the United States, now that President Donald Trump’s 50% tariff on steel and aluminum has kicked in.

articles.title: Over 5,000 lbs. of cheese recalled by FDA due to contamination concerns over 'serious and sometimes fatal' bacteria - yahoo.com
articles.description: Pepper jack, cheddar, farmers and horseradish-flavored cheeses are possibly affected.
